newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt's reserves fall slightly, trend still up.
newsitem.headline: Egypt's reserves fall slightly, trend still up.

text.p: Egypt's foreign reserves stood at about $18.9 billion at the end of February, slightly down on $19 billion at the end of 1996, an official source said on Monday.
The figures are slightly distorted by a payment of $300 million to Egypt's Paris Club creditors during January, disguising an underlying upward trend, the source said.
Egypt's Central Bank has been buying dollars for pounds to sterilise large inflows of foreign capital destined for investment in treasury bills and the stock exchange.
The inflows have put upward pressure on the pound, which has appreciated marginally on the interbank market despite an official policy of keeping the exchange rate stable.
